name: Loft in Antwerp · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Excellent location. There are plenty of great restaurants and coffee bars within walking distance. Feel free to ask me for tips

If you have a car you can reach the freeway to Brussels (E19 and A12) in 5 minutes. Street parking is easy to find and is free from 19:00pm till 9:00am, on Sundays and Public Holidays. There is a cheap underground public parking (Indigo Parking Nationale Bank) within 50 meters, open 24/7.

Across the street, you'll find:
- Pharmacy
- Pizza Hut take away
- affordable but good restaurants (e.g. Continu Food & Drinks)
- Bike Share Station
- Public transportation: bus, tram and taxi
- Antwerp City Park

If you would like to get some groceries, there is a Louis Delhaize Supermarket just around the corner.

There is a local organic bakery (the croissants there are AMAZING!) just around the corner if you want to have a delicious breakfast. There are many good restaurants within walking distance.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.55 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
It is a mixed cultural neighborhood. A lot of young people moved in, providing a new vibe. New restaurants, cafes, shops pop up all the time.
So they call the neighborhood BOHO.
There is a beautiful art deco cinema turned into a cultural centre a bit further. Check the program of 'De Roma' for concerts, films etc.

On the ground floor of the apartment building is a handy small supermarket. Other shops like fresh bakery, butcher, fish are around the corner on the Turnhoutsebaan.

On Friday morning you will find local produce at the vegetable and fruit market at the church of Laar (which you can see from the terrace).

Hop on tram 10 or go for a walk to Zurenborg neighborhood with its famous Cogels-Osylei dotted with dazzling art deco houses.

Ook de befaamde modebuurt met het Modemuseum, Dries Van Noten en andere stijlvolle adresjes ligt op 5 minuten wandelen. In de Kloosterstraat kan je dan weer terecht voor antiek en curiosa, ook op zondagnamiddag!
Voor je boodschappen kan je terecht in supermarkt Carrefour net achter de hoek. Erg handig want deze is ook op zondag geopend!

Op de Vlaamse Kaai zijn er - naast de vele designwinkels - ook enkele delicatessenwinkels en bakkerij Dellafaille (top!) waar je zeker iets naar je gading vindt.

Tussen de historische panden en galerieën, is er voor de kinderen een klein speeltuintje dat zich midden in de straat bevindt.

Vanuit het appartement is het ongeveer 10 minuten lopen naar het trendy Zuid met zijn eigenzinnige winkeltjes, vintagezaakjes en hippe uitgaansgelegenheden.

Ook loop je vanuit de Zirkstraat in korte tijd naar de winkelstraten, historische monumenten en vele cafeetjes en terrassen waar je kunt genieten van het Bourgondische Vlaamse stadsleven.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths

Located in the center of Antwerp (south of city center), the apartment is situated with an abundance of restaurants, bars, shopping, landmarks and galleries. A great location for couples and families visiting Antwerp and seeking a great place to stay.
Due to its proximity to the city center, most places are within walking distance. However, you can also take the tramway or bus – both are 50 meters from the apartment – to help you explore or get around the city:
- Central Station (most beautiful train station in the world!)
- palace on the meir: a genuine palace. The originally 18th century building used to be the home/residence of important rulers such as Napoleon Bonaparte.
- Antwerp Zoo is one of the oldest and best-known zoos in Europe
- Aquatopia is like living under the ocean in the future

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

By foot:
= Zurenborg: trendy area with pubs, restaurant and nice villa's.
= Zoo: the Zoo of Antwerp is the oldest in Belgium, ideal for children.
= Central station: beautiful building completely transformed inside in 2007.
= Meir: the main shopping street of Antwerp.

By bike:
= Centrum: you'll find everything what you want.
= Rivierenhof: big park ideal to have a picnic, to run or to be in the nature; in the summertimes, everyday, open air concert in a spectacular setting
= Park Spoor Noord: big green area with fountains, skate park, ping pong table and place for barbecue, of course there is also a bar and a playground.
= South Antwerp (Het Zuid): the south of the city is the trendy neighborhood where you find trendy restaurants, cozy bars, literary cafes, art galleries, art shops, interior design shops …

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Dit is de absolute topbuurt van Antwerpen. Centraler kan je niet vinden. Je stapt buiten en je komt meteen in een gezellige winkelwandelstraat.
Overal zijn er leuke restaurants, lounge-bars, café's en winkeltjes. De Grote Markt met de historische gildehuizen, het stadhuis en het bekende Brabo-standbeeld, iets verder de Kathedraal en als je de straat uitloopt zit je op de oevers van de Schelde waar je 's zomers gezellig kan vertoeven op het ponton.

Als je graag gaat shoppen dan zit je hier op de beste locatie van Antwerpen. Je bevindt je hier namelijk vlak aan de befaamde modebuurt van Antwerpen. De beroemdste designers hebben hier hun ateliers en winkels in de Nationalestraat, Kammenstraat.
In principe is alles op wandelafstand dankzij de formidabele ligging van het appartement.
Uiteraard zijn er ook andere mogelijkheden zoals trams en metro's. Het metrostation vind je onder de Groenplaats en dus slechts op 500m van het appartement.

One of the more trendy areas of Antwerp: where artists and students live. Lots of culture, restaurants and bars within walking distance. The historic centre is close by as well.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
History of the « Eilandje » :

Eilandje started around 1550 and is the oldest port of Antwerp. In the 19th century, Napoleon Bonaparte had the first two docks excavated for an important naval base. This is followed by an intense flowering period in which several other docks will be excavated.
In the 20th century the port activities shift to the North. Most people move away and the « Eilandje » is a deserted area between port and city.

At the end of the 20th century, one can see the potential of the abandoned docks, quays and warehouses. The city writes, together with the organization "City on the River" an international architectural competition and in the early 1990s the Spanish architect Manuel de Solà-Morales draws an initial plan for The Island. In 1997 René Daniel's works out concrete plans for the Old Docks, the Montevideo district and the Cadix district. In 2002 the « Eilandje » gets its own Master Plan.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The Coquilhatstraat is a straight street which is part of the original allotment of 1875 of this part of town. The street is situated between the Zwijger- and the Verbondstraat and is seperated by the De Vrièrestraat. Historically the name of the street was Vaderlandstraat but was renamed in 1891 after Aimé Coquilhat (1853-1891) who was vice governor of the former Belgian colony.
The Coquilhatstraat has the typical profile of a street at 'the Zuid', with a construction of late 19th century neoclassical cornices alternated with brick gables and with a monumental building as eyecatcher (source: inventaris onroerenderfgoed).

You’ll also find wonderful museums just around the corner; the Royal Museum of Fine Arts (KMSKA), the Museum of Modern Art (MuHKA), the Photography Museum (FoMu) and the Fashion Museum (MoMu) are all just a few minutes walk.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The "Eilandje" district is the oldest port area in Antwerp and is surrounded by water. Today the port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the port feeling still dominates here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones.

For good food, you can undoubtedly find something in one of the many and various eateries in the area. The historic city center is a 20-30 minute walk, where there is an even greater range of food and drink, shopping, entertainment and culture.

The MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House are not to be missed in the immediate vicinity, and underline the connection between the city and the water.

In the neighbourhood itself, you'll find a lot of shops and restaurants, with tastes from all over the world. As Antwerp has about 164 nationalities living in the city (more than New York!!) this is where you can find them. Exotic restaurants side by side with traditional Belgian pubs and Eastern European supermarkets. Looking for something? Sure you can find it here!

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the “Groen Kwartier", a residential park centered around the repurposed buildings of Antwerp’s former Military Hospital, which date all the way back to 1899. With mostly private homes, generous green spaces and little to no motorised traffic, it is the perfect to place to unwind and escape the hustle and bustle of the city, all while keeping its conveniences right on your doorstep.

Several supermarkets, cafes and delis are just a stone’s throw away, and the neighboring boroughs of Zurenborg and Haringrode are teeming with restaurants to suit all tastes.

Nearby places of interest:
- The Jane, 2 Michelin star restaurant with a long waiting list. But in the evenings you can also try their 'drinks & bites' in the upper room bar.
- De Koninck brewery, take the tour and try the beers (discount available for guests)
- Blacksmoke, barbecue restaurant next to the brewery.
- PAKT - what was once a factory now home to various

neighborhood_overview: Zurenborg is a picturesque and lively neighbourhood. It is a unique and protected area in Antwerp, which is famous for its Art Nouveau, Neo-Gothic and Neo-Renaissance architecture. It is full of little bars and restaurants, and is at only 10 minutes on foot from the train station Antwerpen-Berchem. The car-free square "Dageraadplaats" and the square "Draakplaats" are the animated centers of the neighbourhood, lined with bars and restaurants that are always full of local people who sip a drink while keeping an eye on their children playing in the square's playground.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.61 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

You can choose if you continue your walk next to the water and visit 'Het Steen' or through the little streets of Antwerp to enjoy the beautiful facade of the Town hall, the Brabo statue to go the cathedral and to get lost in the shopping streets in the Groenplaats neighbourhood.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

Hotel in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Maison Emile is situated in a quiet, yet central place in the bustling city of Antwerp, the largest city of Flanders. A true metropolis, with one of the biggest harbors in the world, but everything is on a human scale. Architecture, fashion, culture, shopping, all go hand in hand. A visit to Antwerp is something you will never forget, especially when you combine it with a visit in Maison Emile.

There is a tramway, right in front of our door. In just a few minutes it will bring you to all of Antwerp’s landmarks: The central station (declared the most romantic city in the world), the Zoo or our famous shopping street the Meir.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: If this isn’t convincing enough, the location of the house centainly is! Located in one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in Antwerp: Zurenborg. With it’s bello époque grandeur it proudly shows surprised visitors art nouveau façades, elegant streets and lively squares. The highlight is the 19th century Cogels-Osylei: sublime architecture from around the turn of the previous century. The real beating heart of Zurenborg, the Dageraadplaats, lies next around the cornor of Antwerpsdesignhouse. With trees, a star sky and trendy restaurants, this somewhat alternative place is defenitely worthwile visiting!

It’s a 3 minute walk to get there and you’re automatically in the centre of Antwerp. Beginning with the zoo. Going to the shopping area will take another 5 minutes to walk.

Grocery store and bakery are next door! Restaurants are nearby depending on what you’d like to eat.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 4 bedrooms · 14 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The holiday home for 14 people is located in the historic center of Antwerp

You stay in Lange Riddersstraat, a quiet street in the Fashion & Sint Andries District, a few steps from:

- KLOOSTERSTRAAT
Well known street for antiques, brocante, vintage and interior design shops. De Kloosterstraat is also worth visiting on Sunday when all the shops are open.

- VRIJDAGMARKT (FRIDAY MARKET)
A piece of Provence in Antwerp with nice cafés, terraces and with the UNESCO World Heritage Museum of Plantin-Moretus. On Friday morning, the square changes into an outdoor auction of old items and furniture.

- GROENPLAATS
One of the most famous squares of Antwerp with a cozy atmosphere, cafés and restaurants dominated by the beautiful Cathedral of our Lady

- GROTE MARKT
with the impressive building of the Town Hall and the statue of Brabo is overlooking the scenery.

- FASHION DISTRICT
With many renowned designers

neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp, start here: https://www.visitantwerpen.be/en/home.

We are located near the city centre, the Antwerp Central Station is hardly 10 minutes away by foot, and nearby are also the green Park Spoor Noord hotspot and the ever vibrant Sint-Jansplein, Anwerp's largest open area. This loft is your ideal haven to experience the beauty of Antwerp with its lovely cafes, premium restaurants, bars shopping stores, stunning museums and beautiful architecture and famous landmarks.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is located in one of the most beautiful suburbs of Antwerp, close to the major parks of the city.

It is close to 'Den Brandt Park', 'Nightingale Park' and 'Middelheim Park', the latter with art monuments (free entrance). These parks are among the most beautiful of Flanders and definitely the most beautiful of Antwerp. In Den Brandt Park (in the former coach house of the castle) you have the amazing restaurant Danieli il Divino, in a gorgeous setting with great staff and a fantastic menu, it's simply never disappointing!

Across the street you'll find a Carrefour Express. Within 100m you can find a pharmacy, a grocer, a fishmonger, a fromagerie, a pizzeria, a winery, a chip shop, and a Chinese Restaurant. Across the street one also finds a nice Italian restaurant (La Tavola Italiana).

Wilrijk is also home to the largest Jain Temple (outside of India) constructed entirely from beautiful white marble.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

Some things close-by: The cathedral, Het Steen, Vrijdagsmarkt, the pedestrian tunnel (De Voetgangerstunnel) that takes you to the other side (Linkeroever) of the river (De Schelde), City Hall, De Schelde (river), cozy restaurants / bars, art galleries, shops, ...

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Amongst locals, our neighbourhood is called ‘Seefhoek’, which is known as a vibrant, multicultural place in town, right next to the old city center. In our colourful streets you can not only buy fresh fruit, vegetables and fish, you can also discover some real gems like an art deco bathhouse and an old theatre. During a 5 minute walk to the central station you come across ‘Winkelhaak’ design centre, ‘Permeke’, our beautiful antwerp library and Antwerp’s own China town, which is hardly more than 1 street :)
Discover our finest beers at ‘Beer lover’s bar’, get into some real old skool belgian folklore at restaurant 'Den Beer' where you can enjoy delicious lobster at very fair prices, or enjoy a freshly brewed coffee at 'Viggo's', all just around the corner!

name: Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 6 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: De Vogeltjesmarkt is de afgelopen decennia getransformeerd tot een toeristische markt. Iedere zondag komen er duizenden voornamelijk Nederlandse en Belgische bezoekers naar de Antwerpse Theaterbuurt om tussen de honderden stand te wandelen. In veel gevallen komt men vooral om te sfeer te proeven. Serieus inkopen doen is niet altijd aan de orde. Het toeristische karakter is vooral duidelijk zichtbaar in het veranderde aanbod. Vogelen, pluimvee en knaagdieren koop je alleen nog maar in het hart van de Graanmarkt. Voor de rest zijn het vooral algemeen handelswaren, kleding, lekkernijen en accessoires wat je in de stands ziet. Naast nieuwe producten vind je ook kraampjes met antiek, brocante en tweedehands spullen op de Vogeltjesmarkt. Daarnaast is Opvallend is het toenemend aantal Nederlandse marktkooplui dat op de Vogeltjesmarkt staat.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We zijn gelegen op het fantastische Theaterplein, op loopafstand van de winkelstraat Meir, Centraal station en het oude Antwerpen. Elk weekend (zaterdag-zondag) is er een uitgebreide markt opgesteld en vanuit onze appartementen hebt u hier een mooi uitzicht op en geniet je van de échte antwerpse sfeer op het plein. Kom je dus met de auto raden we u aan om bij ons een parking te reserveren (vlakbij het appartement).


Benieuwd naar leuke hotspots om lekker te eten en te drinken in Antwerpen? Ik heb hier een aantal plekjes op een rij gezet. Allen op loopafstand :

- Chocolate Line (waar je de lekkerste chocolade kunt kopen)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to our rustic petit apartment in the historic city center of beautiful Antwerp.

The location is in Antwerp's student area, perfect in the middle between the "Grote markt" and the "Meir" - highstreet shopping.

It's a very quite street, but surroundend with nice little restaurants and bars and great shops.
Just around the corner of the Hendrik Conscience square with its beautifull buildings from the 17th century, a must visit!

From the apartment you can easily walk to the shopping, nightlife or theater district or to the docks ("kaaien").

Just a perfect spot to enjoy the beautifull city of Antwerp!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.22 · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A charming and modern designed apartment, situated in the heart of the historical centre of Antwerp, accessible with public transport. It is completely renovated in 2016. The 120m2 apartment includes a large living room, 3 bedrooms (with King-sized beds in separated bedrooms), a kitchen, a modern bathroom and 。1 separate toilets.

The neighborhood has a lot of great cafés, culinair restaurants and bars and is just beside Antwerp's largest shopping mall. Everything is within walking distance from the apartment. You can find a lot of touristic sites.

A nice and comfortabel apartment for you, your family and friends to enjoy an amazing time in Antwerp.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
I live near the central station of Antwerp. When you enter the metro you can take tram 10 towards 'Schoonselhof'. You get off the stop after 'Kasteelplein'.
You can also take tram 8 towards 'Zuid' and also here take the stop after 'Kasteelplein' off. If you take this tram you only have to cross the street and you are already at the apartment. Watch the traffic;).
If you like to walk, you should count 25 minutes :).
There is a lot to discover and where I live is just outside the center but with public transport and even by foot everything is easily accessible :).
Restaurants and bars can be reached within walking distance.
Every Sunday there is a market on the theater square. We call it 'Vogeltjesmarkt'.

neighborhood_overview:
The loft is situated in the very nice neighbourhood of Borgerhout and Zurenborg.
At the Borgerhout side there is a vibrant multi-cultural atmosphere.
At the Zurenborg side there is beautiful architecture and a lot of restaurants around Dageraadplaats.
The hip and cultural South ('Zuid') of Antwerp is at short biking distance , as well as the green area of 'Park Spoor Noord' and the maritime area 'Eilandje' in the North of Antwerp.
Lots to do here!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath

During the summer there are many concerts and flea markets on the square. There is also a playground for kids and a basketball field.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in one of the nicest neighborhoods, only 10 minutes walk to "de Singel" if you want to pick a jazz concert, dance or theater show. There are 3 beautiful parks around the apartment, and beer brewery " De Koninck" is only 5 minutes walk. There are a few nice coffee bars in the streets around if you want to have a good breakfast to start the day. Also there is a bike stations right next to the building (Red Velo's) where you can pick a bike to get around. City center, shopping area's, museums and lots of unique landmark are only 15 min by bike, 30 min walk or 20 min by tram. Lots of nice (wine) bars and restaurants are so close, you can walk every where if you love to discover this beautiful city.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.93 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: TOP LOCATION! The apartment is settled in Antwerpen-Zuid, the vibrant part of the city. Across the street there are many of the most well known local restaurants in Antwerp and of course the famous Museum of fine arts, "Museum voor Schone Kunsten", a building you cannot miss! You find also the museum of modern art, "Mukha", and the photo museum in a few minutes walk. When the sun is shining we definitely recommend "Marnix plaats", the city square that catches all the sunlight with many nice cafe's and restaurants. The shopping streets (Meir, Nationale straat, Schuttershofstraat, etc.) are all at walking distance from the apartment. (Supermarket and bank are at 1 min walking distance.)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.40 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: In the apartment you will find a folder with all kinds of tips about the neighborhood! The apartment is 10 minutes walk from the central station and the zoo. You then walk along the Offerandestraat, which is a car-free shopping street, where you will also find the supermarket Albert Heyn. You can also shop in the Chinese street for typical Asian specialties, or in the regular supermarket there, which is located in an old market hall! In the other direction you walk further to Borgerhout, with the Turnhoutsebaan as axis along which you will find all kinds of parks, squares and eating and drinking places. Or you can walk further towards the Seefhoek, where you will find, among other things, beautiful Park Spoor Noord. Borgerhout and the Seefhoek are both authentic and lively neighborhoods of Antwerp.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.44 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.07 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafés and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.

apartment is situated on the main axes to Antwerp.

This apartment is a 20 minute walk or 6 minute tram ride from the center of Antwerp. The Cathedral is at 2 km, the Meir and the Rubens House at 1.5 km, Het Steen at 2.3 km. Palace of Fine Arts or MUKHA 1.2 km. Central station 1.3 km.

The Cathedral: After 169 years of construction the cathedral of Antwerp finally dominated Antwerp's skyline in 1521 with a height of 123 metres. It's the highest Gothic building in the Low Countries.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 6 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

And ofcourse there are plenty of restaurants, bars and breakfast places in the neighborhood.
Public transport is at 100m, a 10 minute walk from the central station and also parking facilities are to be found at walking distance.

In short, you'll never be bored!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartement is just a step away from "Het Eilandje", or so called “The Little Island,”
A few years ago, the city of Antwerp started a successful re-development of the old harbor district known as the legendary Schipperskwartier”
Today this neighborhood is a cozy place with a rich history and a limited well-kept and traffic-free tolerance zone for the oldest profession.
The city of Antwerp won the prize for the broad yet precise way in which it approached the red light district in recent years, both socially and spatially.
In the past decade, the harbor area has gone from scruffy maritime wasteland to foodie haven and museum central. Ask any local what prompted the change, and they’ll most likely point you to the MAS, a remarkable sandstone-colored construction. Today, the district boasts waterfront cafés, lofts and another successful museum, The Red Star Line, dedicated to the eponymous Antwerp cruiser company and the millions of emigrants it carried oversea

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our airbnb is located in the city center next to the historic neighbourhood and close to the Mas museum and Schelde river bank. The Eilandje, one of the nicest quarters in Antwerp, with his restaurants, harbour and museums is a 3 min walk, the iconic Havenhuis is 15 min further down the riverbank. From the apartment you can walk straight to our lovely Cathedral, in between the Groenplaats en Grote markt. This is the heart of Antwerp. In this area you will find all the bars and restaurants, the diamond museum, the historic buildings surrounding the Grote markt. If you walk further to the south the fashion district awaits you. 5 min to the north of the apartment, you can stroll along the river banks of the Schelde. There are 2 supermarkets within 300m and a laundromat at 50m of the appartment. Long stays may use our washing machine free of charge.
A cheap parking for you car is locate within a 10 min walk.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We zijn gelegen op het fantastische Theaterplein, op loopafstand van de winkelstraat Meir, Centraal station en het oude Antwerpen. Elk weekend (zaterdag-zondag) is er een uitgebreide markt opgesteld en vanuit onze appartementen hebt u hier een mooi uitzicht op en geniet je van de échte antwerpse sfeer op het plein. Kom je dus met de auto raden we u aan om bij ons een parking te reserveren (vlakbij het appartement).


Benieuwd naar leuke hotspots om lekker te eten en te drinken in Antwerpen? Ik heb hier een aantal plekjes op een rij gezet. Allen op loopafstand :

- Chocolate Line (waar je de lekkerste chocolade kunt kopen)
- Me & my monkey (koffie en gebak)
- Poke Tiki (voor lekkere pokebowls)
- Pasta Hippo Vino (Italiaans restaurant)
- Bún (Vietnamese street food)
- Felixpakhuis (voor ontbijt of lunch)
- Barnini (voor ontbijt op het Theaterplein)
- Graanmarkt 13 (voor lunch of brunch)
- Tinsel (voor koffie of lunch)

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Het huis is gelegen in de St-Andrieswijk. Dit is “de” modebuurt in Antwerpen met tal van ontdekkingen, designer shops, vintage winkels, etc...

De straat zelf is ver buiten Antwerpen gekend om z'n mode designer winkels.

Er zijn toffe pleintjes in de buurt en uiteraard het echte stadscentrum waar altijd wat te beleven en ontdekken valt.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.56 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths

We left an overview of things to do in the apartment and you can always get in touch to know what's going on in Antwerp during your stay.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.27 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.30 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The Zuid ("South") in Antwerp is a currently fashionable area of Antwerp. Revived in the mid-1980s, it has an attractive street plan and a few Art Nouveau buildings, such as the former Volkshuis (or Maison du Peuple) on the Volkstraat, but which now houses the Rudolf Steiner school. Three museums, numerous commercial art galleries, fashionable cafes and restaurants, two arts' centres and a sprinkling of up-market shops add to the attractions of the area.

The studio is situated in a quiet side street with everything you need in a short, walkable distance. There is a bakery, butchery, cheese shop, several big supermarkets and pharmacy on Herentalsebaan (main street) all within 1-5 minutes walk.

You can reach several parks within 10 minutes walk. Boelaerpark & Boekenbergpark border to several organic/hipster coffeeshops. Rivierenhof is the biggest park with a huge lake where you can make nice walks and picnics.
There is a swimming pool within 20 minutes walk from the house.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Smack in the middle of Antwerp center located at the Meir. The biggest shopping street in Antwerp. The apartment is two doors down from "het stads paleis" the former residence of Napoleon Bonaparte and the home of famous painter Peter Paul Rubens House is just around the corner in 5 minutes walking distance. The Stadsschouwburg of Antwerp and the Antwerp Opera house is within 10 minutes walking distance. Amazing Michellin star restaurants and affordable restaurants are all in walking distance. If you would like to explore the city by bike there are shared "Velo" bikes parked in front of the building.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Cross the river
As Europe’s second biggest port, the river Scheldt is Antwerp’s lifeblood.
The Left Bank is an exceptional part of Antwerp. A major asset of Linkeroever is the open and green character. Summer pop-ups and epic city views.

De Molen is a big open air swimming pool on the left side of the river (Left Bank). It might not be the first place to come to mind when you want to go for a swim but it has a lot of charm and there is a lot to do: take a stroll on St. Anneke Beach, have a picnic and enjoy the most beautiful views you'll find in Antwerp.

Antwerp is full of surprises. Take its city beach, Saint Anneke, on the left bank, for example, where you can come for a walk, a nice meal or just to chillax.

Saint Anna Beach on the left bank refers to the former village of Saint Anna, when the beach was a popular attraction with many of the locals. They would typically come here by ferry to enjoy the famous mussels of Saint Anneke.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: This beautiful loft is located on the best location for visiting Antwerp!! Situated in the no car zone. Steps away from famous musea, shops at the Meir and café's. Building with open floor plan and modern kitchen. Have your Belgian beer on the balcony and enjoy the view!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 shared baths
Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The loft lays close to the trendy neighborhood "Het Eilandje".
Het Eilandje – ‘The Little Island’ – is so-called for good reason: Antwerp’s oldest port area is surrounded by water. Today, port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the feeling of a port is still very much present. Savour the historical atmosphere of the old loading dock with its monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones. Three major attractions, MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House, have once again drawn attention to the links between the city and the water.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath

Lichte kamers waarvan de grote met klimaatbeheersing
Te voet bent u in 10 minuten bij het Museum aan de Stroom (MAS) en in 15 minuten bij het Red Star Line Museum.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 1 bed · 3.5 baths

neighborhood_overview:
Onze woning is de ideale uitvalsbasis als u Antwerpen wil beleven in alle facetten die de stad rijk is:

WATER: Op 300m van onze deur kunt u gaan uitwaaien of joggen op de kaaien langs de rivier Schelde. De jachthaven en boottochten zijn eveneens op wandelafstand

CULTUUR: Bij ons slaapt u bijna "onder de toren" van de Sint-Pauluskerk. Neem zeker hier een kijkje waar u nog schilderijen van Rubens, Jordaens,... kan bewonderen. Verder kan u op nog geen 600m de rijke geschiedenis van Antwerpen opsnuiven in het MAS en de oude stadskern.

ETEN & DRINKEN: In de directe omgeving vindt u talrijke terrasjes om te genieten van een Antwerps biertje of lekker eten. Om de hoek vindt u tal van restaurants, bistro en het sterrenrestaurant Nathan. Graag adviseren we u bij uw keuze.

Wij bieden zelf geen ontbijt aan, maar graag bevelen we u enkele ontbijtrestaurants aan op nog geen 5 minuten wandelen.

SHOPPING: Antwerpen is de stad bij uitstek om

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · 3 bedrooms · 2.5 baths
Bed and breakfast in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
B&B Borgerhouse is located in the heart of Borgerhout (Antwerp), on the traffic-free Moorkensplein.

The ideal base to explore Antwerp and its surroundings from a different angle. The Moorkensplein was beautifully redeveloped a few years ago and is an attraction in the super-diverse Borgerhouse. Restaurants and shops nearby.

Antwerp Central Station, Antwerp Zoo, De Roma arts centre or Zeno X art gallery are all within walking distance. Just like the trendy Zurenborg with its listed Belle Epoque houses on the Cogels-Osylei and its cosy terraces on the Dageraadplaats. The Sportpaleis, the MAS and Park Spoor Noord are within cycling distance.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.82 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
Townhouse in Antwerp · ★4.75 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer and public parkings, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafés and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.

Elk weekend (zaterdag-zondag) is er een uitgebreide markt opgesteld en vanuit onze appartementen hebt u hier een mooi uitzicht op en geniet je van de échte antwerpse sfeer op het plein. Kom je dus met de auto raden we u aan om bij ons een parking te reserveren (vlakbij het appartement).


Benieuwd naar leuke hotspots om lekker te eten en te drinken in Antwerpen? Ik heb hier een aantal plekjes op een rij gezet. Allen op loopafstand :

- Chocolate Line (waar je de lekkerste chocolade kunt kopen)
- Me & my monkey (koffie en gebak)
- Poke Tiki (voor lekkere pokebowls)
- Pasta Hippo Vino (Italiaans restaurant)
- Bún (Vietnamese street food)
- Felixpakhuis (voor ontbijt of lunch)
- Barnini (voor ontbijt op het Theaterplein)
- Graanmarkt 13 (voor lunch of brunch)
- Tinsel (voor koffie of lunch)

of alternatief weektarief 2 straten verder +-28 EUR/week). Op de hoek heb je een velo-station. Handig om overal naartoe te fietsen (weektarief +-10 EUR). Best op voorhand reserveren. Meer info vind je op https://www.velo-antwerpen.be/.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nice places to visit:

This cosy apartment is located 10 minutes walking from the central station in a social and cultural area.

Next to the station you can visit the Zoo of Antwerp.

Here also starts the main shopping street that leads you to the historical center with good restaurants and a view on “De Schelde”, river and the port lying next to city.

When you are here you can choose to go the cultural South or the student and harbour area in the North. Both sides have interesting bars and other places worthy to visit.

5 minutes walking from my place you have Zurenborg, a modern area with very good restaurants and bars.

Finally you can visit the central park which is located 5 minutes walking from my place.

neighborhood_overview:
De Belegstraat ligt in de wijk van de Brederode. Deze interessante en bruisende buurt ligt tussen het Zuid en de Markgrave. Dit is de meest diverse buurt van Antwerpen: je vindt er de hipste koffiebars, parken, musea, theater maar je kan er ook de beste Durum eten.

Na 10 minuten stappen ben je aan het historische centrum (boerentoren, kathedraal). Evengoed ben je na tien minuten stappen aan het harmoniepark. Alles ligt binnen handbereik, zeker gegeven de verschillende vervoersmogelijkheden.

In de directe buurt zijn volgende zaken een echte aanrader:

- koffiebar Nordica - scandinavische lunch en heerlijke koffie
- brasserie Walrus - Franse keuken op zijn heerlijkst
- theater De Monty - altijd weer een beleving

Na een kleine wandeling bevelen we tevens aan:

- de Kloosterstraat - de mooiste antiekstraat van Antwerpen
- het Zuid - bruisend van horeca en het MSK

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.65 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
De Pretstraat 72 is gelegen vlakbij de jachthaven ( het MAS ) en de oude stadskern. Nabij gelegen is het onlangs gerenoveerde Antwerps Badhuis ( art deco ) waar je rustig kan zwemmen en genieten van de wellness. Om de hoek is bistro de 'Rode 7', een plaats waar locals en kunstenaars graag vertoeven. Deze plek heeft een uniek kader en is een begrip in Antwerpen. Je kan er lekker eten aan democratische prijzen. De buurt resideert klinkende namen zoals Panamarenko, Fred Bervoets en Werner Mannaers. Deze laatste had zijn atelier op dit adres.
Kortom een perfecte locatie voor een leuke stadswandeling in het groen, een fietstocht langs de Schelde met eventueel een bezoek aan het pittoreske Bazel, Lillo of Doel, een havenrondvaart met de Flandria of het ontdekken van art-deco-gebouwen in de Cogels-Osylei, het degusteren van Belgische bieren of het exploreren van de Antwerpse gastronomie dewelke uniek is in de wereld. Typische , nabijgelegen bistro's zijn : Bistrot du Nord, Bar du Port e

neighborhood_overview:
Offering a cool and trendy flat with city view, Industrial cave is set in Antwerp, 400 m from Meir and 700 m from De Keyserlei. The accommodation is 400 m from Rubenshuis, and guests benefit from private parking available on site (limited spots available €15/day) and free WiFi for all guests.

A terrace is available for guests to use at the apartment.

Popular points of interest include Groenplaats Antwerp, Plantin-Moretus Museum and Astrid Square Antwerp. The nearest airport is Antwerp International Airport, 4 km from the accommodation.

This is our guests' favourite part of Antwerp, according to independent reviews.
Couples particularly like the location — they rated it 10 for a city-person trip.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

neighborhood_overview:
OLD BERCHEM - Antwerp
This is the part of Berchem that lies just inside the city's ring road, close to major access roads and at the same time a stone's throw from the beautiful old center. In addition, this residential area features beautiful homes built at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th century. Oud-Berchem can be recognized by the elegant stately mansions, beautiful belle-époque houses that used to belong to the officers and the colorful houses that can be found in picturesque hidden alleys. This neighborhood has its own park, namely the Koning Albertpark. Oud-Berchem is very accessible because of the Berchem train station and the Antwerp Ring.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.29 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is one of my favorite areas in Antwerp. The street itself is quiet but just around the corner is a lively neighborhood full of cozy bars and restaurants.

It's on walking distance from the Museum of Fine Arts, which is a famous district with lots of galleries, cozy bars and restaurants. An area all the locals go to. If you love art, this apartment might be a good place for you since the best galleries are just a few minutes away on foot.

If you walk 5min you'll be at the river side where you can enjoy the most colorful sunsets or go rollerskating or longboarding. It has a long walking boulevard and goes all the way to the other side of the city.

There is another park nearby just next to the palais of justice which is called 'konijnenwei' (Rabbit Meadow). It's more wild than other parks and a lot more peaceful. Perfect for a morning walk or picknick.

The Turkish street 'Brederode' is also closeby which makes it easy to find cheap and fres

neighborhood_overview:
Zurenborg is known for its cozy squares and beautiful residential streets with stately mansions. The Dageraadplaats is the lively center at its heart The square acts as the garden for the many young families in the area.
In the evening the lighting creates a southern atmosphere while the restaurants and terraces are usually completely full.

On Thursdays, the market stocks its stalls. A little further on is the Draakplaats where various terraces and cafes also bring a pleasant atmosphere to its stately surroundings. It is a neighborhood that is bustling and alive and considered one of, scratch that, the most aesthetic and enjoyable area(s) of the city.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood, called ‘Seefhoek’ among locals, is a vibrant, multicultural area harboring many small local shops. The Winkelhaak design centre, the public library Permeke, supermarket Criee (famous for its butcher shops) and China town are just around the corner, Central Station and the Zoo are a 10-minute walk, the famous shopping street Meir another 5 minutes further. Beer lovers will want to check out Beer lovers bar and coffee lovers will find something of their liking at Viggo’s, both located at Coninckplein. Several mediterranean fish restaurants are located in the Handelsstraat, where you can also find the folkloric restaurant Den Beer, famous for its lobster. For great freshly-baked pizza, check out Loes & Krikke in the Congresstraat.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Harmonie neighborhood is a charming and historic district in Antwerp, Belgium. It is located in the city's south, and is known for its beautiful Art Nouveau architecture, its tree-lined streets, and its lively atmosphere with a whole bunch of cafes and restaurants!

The neighborhood is named after the Harmonie, a former music hall that was built in the 19th century. The hall was demolished in the 1970s, but the name has lived on. A lot of street names (including mine) have a musical touch :)

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located a 15min walk from the Central Station and is located in the upcoming and trendy neighbourhood of Park Spoor Noord, which is a large urban park with a summer bar and lots of green areas for picnicking or sports. The historical City Centre, the shopping streets, the trendy “Eilandje” with a.o. several of the landmark museums of Antwerp, the marina and lots of nice bars and restaurants are all only a short walk away. A great staging area for a visit of Antwerp! The new Cadix hospital as well as a large number of university buildings are also located nearby.

neighborhood_overview:
Het Eilandje did not steal its name: Antwerp's oldest port area is surrounded by water. Today, port activity is concentrated more to the north, but the port feeling still prevails here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones. Thanks to three crowd-pullers, the MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House, the connection between the city and the water is once again underlined.

At the foot of the London Tower, the Island is connected by the famous Park Bridge to "Park Spoor Noord" , a very spacious, open and green park that emphasizes greenery, light, space, relaxation, culture, sports and events.
The park is built on a 24-hectare old railroad yard that had been abandoned for years. It has several playgrounds, a spectacular bmx and skatebowl, two delightful water playgrounds and a shelter with bar Cargo's temporary summer terrace. The park is a hit with Antwerp residents who

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Shipping container in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · ★4.57 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This area of Antwerp is hot and happening!!! It belongs to the old and rich neighborhood 't Zuid, which now is known as a vibrant neighborhood with a lot of great great restaurants, high fashion and haute couture, amazing facades and architecture and the biggest and richest museum of Flanders: the KMSKA. Located in a quiet side street of this neighborhood, you will walk from this apartment within 5 minutes to the KMSKA, within 5 minutes to the Marnixplaats, within 10 minutes to the Nationalestraat and within 15 minutes to the Grote Markt and historic center of Antwerp.
You can also easily take trams and busses at the end of the street to Antwerp Central Station and to all other highlights and hotspots in the city.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerp South is the hotspot for residents from over whole Antwerp en outer areas to stroll around. Seen and be seen. Enjoy the terraces, the fine diner at the bistro's and restaurants. Away from the tourists. Vibrant and trendy are the superlatives used in magazines when describing this neighbourhood in magazines.

Must visits: Marnixplaats, Leopold de Waalplaats, Scheldekaaien, Vlaamse- en Waalsekaai, St Andries, Wilde Zee, Fashion Quarter, de Meir, Operaplein, Museum of fine Arts, Museum of Temporary Art, museum MAS, the docks and harbour, Stadsfeestzaal, Central Station, Palace of Justice, the Cathedral of Our Lady, Red Light district, etc. Everything is between 20 and 2000 meter from the accommodation.

Small supermarkt at 200m, large supermarkt at 400m. A nightshop with limited assortiment at 30m just around the corner. Terraces and eating at Marnixplaats square at 50m.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the vibrant city of Antwerp, where history, culture, and modernity converge to create a unique and captivating neighborhood experience.

Antwerp, the second-largest city in Belgium, is renowned for its rich history as a major port city, once considered the center of the world's diamond trade. Today, it has evolved into a dynamic and cosmopolitan metropolis with a diverse population, offering something for every visitor.

The city's historic center is a treasure trove of architectural wonders, characterized by stunning medieval buildings and charming cobblestone streets. Explore the iconic Cathedral of Our Lady, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture housing impressive artworks, including paintings by Peter Paul Rubens.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Onze woning is vlakbij het prachtige Te Boelaerpark gelegen. Ook het Boekenbergpark, het mooie Rivierenhof en Zurenborg met zijn magnifieke Art Nouveau woningen zijn op wandel- of fietsafstand.

Er zijn gezellige cafés en restaurants in de buurt en met de tram, bus of fiets sta je op 10 minuten op de Meir. Zowel de tram als de bus stoppen vlakbij onze woning. Er is ook een Velo station (deelfiets-systeem) op 150 m van de woning. Tevens kent de stad Antwerpen vele andere deelsystemen (SWAP fietsen, deelsteps, Poppy wagens,…) waardoor het erg makkelijk wordt om je doorheen de stad te verplaatsen.

Bakkers, beenhouwers, supermarkten, speeltuin, restaurantjes, wijnbars,… zijn allemaal op wandelafstand.

neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.10 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

neighborhood_overview:
The Hoogstraat is located in the heart of the old historic center. It's a shopping pedestrian street (no car traffic), so during the day, there's a lot of liveliness – even on Sundays! – but in the evening and night, it's wonderfully peaceful for sleeping.

The Hoogstraat and the surrounding streets of the old city center are home to numerous restaurants, bars, and every type of shop you can imagine!

Top attractions in the nearby vicinity:

☆ Cathedral of Our Lady (Onze-Lieve-Vrouwekathedraal)
☆ Grand Place (Grote Markt)
☆ City Hall (Stadhuis)
☆ The Stone (Het Steen)
☆ St. Charles Borromeo's Church (Sint-Carolus Borromeuskerk)
☆ Museum aan de Stroom (MAS)
☆ Red Star Line Museum
☆ Plantin-Moretus Museum
☆ Fashion Museum (MoMu)
☆ Museum of Sound (Het Vleeshuis)
☆ DIVA (Museum of Diamonds)
☆ Vlaeykensgang
☆ Saint Anne's Tunnel (Sint-Annatunnel)
☆ Rubenshuis (currently closed)

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You can shop car-free on the Meir, take a walk along the quays, take the ferry to Linkeroever (Sint Anneke Plage, forest walk), explore the island with the Red Star Line museum and MAS (Museum Aan de Stroom) where you can enjoy a very nice view on the top floor (viewing is free). Don't forget to take a look at the beautifully renovated Felix warehouse. You can eat very well in the MAS, but you need to book well in advance. If you cross the Sint Paulusplaats you will come to the Sint Pauluskerk, where you can, for example, view a painting by Rubens. In the Sint Paulusstraat you will find nice coffee houses / wine tastings. In any case, the area offers extensive options for good food; after all you are the touristic center of Antwerp.
You are close to various student facilities such as: art academy, Artesis, Ufsia, Karel de grote Hogeschool.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerpen wordt ook wel dé modestad genoemd en dat kan je in deze buurt volop ontdekken...

Op de Meir vind je voornamelijk de grote ketens. Kijk niet alleen naar de etalages maar bewonder ook de adembenemende architectuur van de winkelpanden uit de 18de en 19de eeuw.

Hou je meer van hip en trendy dan is de Kammenstraat zeker een bezoekje waard. De Nationalestraat en de omliggende straten, waaronder de Lombarden- en Steenhouwersvest, vormen het modieuze hart van Antwerpen.

Voor iedereen die geïnteresseerd is in geschiedenis, monumenten en sfeervolle pleinen en straten... ook het historisch centrum is vlakbij!

Ook andere wijken zoals 't Zuid, 't Eilandje, Zurenborg of Diamand zijn zeker een bezoekje waard.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
De locatie is perfect voor rustzoekers en levensgenieters. Met het stadspark op slechts 1 minuut loopafstand, kunt u genieten van ontspannende wandelingen en momenten van sereniteit. Voor de dagelijkse benodigdheden bevindt de Jumbo-supermarkt zich op slechts 5 minuten loopafstand.

Ontdek de culinaire geneugten van de buurt: ontbijt- en brunchplek 'Barchel' op slechts 3 minuten loopafstand. U kunt ook gemakkelijk de stad verkennen met de tramhalte 'hemel' op slechts een steenworp afstand in de lange leem straat.

Voor degenen die van markten en gezelligheid houden, ligt het theaterplein op slechts 8 minuten loopafstand, waar u kunt genieten van de heerlijke zaterdag- en zondagmarkt en talloze gezellige horecagelegenheden.

Voor de shopliefhebbers onder u is het winkelcentrum van de stad, de Meir, slechts 13 minuten lopen verwijderd.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the trendy South. Within walking distance you will find several cozy restaurants and cafes. Public transport is right at the door and there are also shared bicycles nearby.

The trendy south is known for its stately mansions, wide boulevards and beautiful squares. Art lovers will enjoy themselves thanks to the many art galleries and museums such as the FOMU and the M HKA. Shopping enthusiasts also have an ideal base from here. In the Volkstraat you can admire design products, unique accessories, interior pieces and beautiful clothing in the shop windows. Additionally, it's a stone's throw from the center of Antwerp. By public transport you are in 10 minutes in the city center.

Food and drinks

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.82 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths

Wij wonen in een levendige wijk, bewoond door mensen met een afkomst van over de hele wereld. Op een groot plein aan het einde van onze straat, vind je verschillende soorten bars en restaurants: Italiaans, Portugees, Turks, Marokkaans ... Op geregelde tijdstippen wordt het plein gebruikt voor markten, optredens en dergelijke. Aan het andere eind van onze straat ligt een groot park, waarover we u later meer zullen vertellen.

Laten we u meenemen op een tochtje door onze buurt om u een paar hoogtepunten te laten zien die we passeren als we gaan joggen. Allereerst is er Park Spoor Noord, een voormalig spoorwegemplacement waar treinen goederen naar de haven vervoerden en waar ze gerepareerd konden worden, nu omgetoverd tot een park met sportfaciliteiten, speeltuinen, een skatepark, een Scandinavisch restaurant en een zomerbar. Langs een jachtclub en een dok met woonboten komt u bij het Havenhuis, een voormalige brandweerkazerne die is verbouwd door de beroemde architecte Zaha Ha

It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. On the other end is Park Spoor Noord, an oasis of greenery where people come together to relax.
Aside from these characteristic areas nearby, the old city centre of Antwerp is still in walking distance from the apartment.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp's South has it all: loads of restaurants (all types of food & price ranges), nice bars on the corner of every street, interesting musems (Fine Arts, Contemporary Arts, Photo museum, galleries), the newly renovated pedestrian Scheldt Quays, several parks with playgrounds for children (New South, Konijnenwei, Vlaamse Kaai), fine architecture (new Justice Palace, KMSKA, Het Bootje, Lambertmontplaats,... ). Off course, Antwerp has much more to offer, but if don't feel like looking too far, than South will surely offer you all that you need.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: De woning is gelegen in een rustige, residentiële wijk in het Antwerpse stadsdistrict Deurne. Geen doorgaand verkeer, 30-km beperking in de straat. Op enkele wandelminuutjes bevindt zich het prachtige Rivierenhof. Een enorm stadspark met kastelen, vijvers, kilometers aan wandelpaden, speeltuinen en restaurants. Bij de dichtstbijzijnde ingangen van dit park ook: een kinderboerderij en het Open Lucht Theater met in de zomermaanden elke vrijdag een gratis concert. Ook op wandelafstand (ongeveer 25 minuten) het legendarische Bosuil Stadion van Royal Antwerp FC. Op 200 meter wandelen vindt U de halte van de sneltram 10 waarmee u binnen de 10 minuten in het centrum van Antwerpen bent. Of in de andere richting op enkele haltes bij het grote Wijnegem Shopping Center.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Loft in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Right in the heart of the hipster area Zuid (The South), in between Marnix Plaats and Leopold de Leopold de Waelplaats with many trendy restaurants, bars, brunch cafés and art galleries. Zuid is a little gem if you are looking for a well-frequented, quiet, yet animated and well located neighbourhood in Antwerp. The studio is located right in front of the Art Museum and the street residential. Make a left when you are leaving the studio and you will find a few cafés serving breakfasts, brunches and plenty of dining out options : vegetarian, Lebanese, Thai, Chinese, Italian, Japanese, French cuisine and of course, some burger places ! Fancy art, museums or fashion ? Fancy architecture ? Zuid is well-known for stately mansions, wide boulevards and beautiful squares. Art and fashion lovers will appreciate the many art galleries, small independent shops and museums.

neighborhood_overview:
This accommodation is centrally located. In the Pulhof district you will find within walking distance a delicious artisanal butcher’s store Buermans and bakery Lebleu, but you are also close to supermarkets Albert Heyn and Carrefour, Belgian fast food restaurant Quick and you can not miss out the famous Belgian fries at frituur Pulhof.
Do you prefer to eat out? Then you have many nice restaurants in the close area to have lunch, aperitifs or dinner: TAM TAM, Repos, Chasse Royal, Ikebana and many more.

The trendy district of Oud-Berchem has some nice places to have breakfast or coffee and you can easily get to these cosy bars and restaurants by bike (5 minutes) or by tram (2 stops).
The public transport will take you in less than 20 minutes to the centre of Antwerp city.
The tram stop for tram lines 15 and 7 is located just at the end of the street and there is a tram every ten minutes.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This hidden gem is located in Zurenborg - an attractive and affluent part of Antwerp. It also happens to be one of the safest neighborhoods! (Antwerp Police Headquarter just around the corner)

The perfect place to wind down after a long day of exploring Antwerp or working from home or office.

Kick back and relax with a nice cocktail in the courtyard of Den Draak, enjoy home made falafels in the courtyard of Yalla Yalla or devour a 3 course meal at Michelin guided Dome if you're feeling fancy. Options are available for every budget and the choices are endless!

Other must see highlights:

-COGELS-OSYLEI (known as the most beautiful and expensive street in Antwerp) famous for its 19th century art nouveau mansions and stunning architecture. They are listed as heritage monuments and can never be altered.

Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath

neighborhood_overview:
U bevindt zich in het historische centrum in het gezelligste straatje met op de hoek van de straat het oudste café van Antwerpen. De buurt is gekend voor zijn vele ateliers, antiquairs, expositieruimtes en goudsmids.

Loop letterlijk het hoekje om voor een bruisend terrasje, geprezen cocktailbar of culinaire beleving. Laat u vooral onderdompelen in het culturele centrum. Zin om zelf te koken? Dan staat een volledig uitgeruste keuken tot uw beschikking.

Het Moriaanstraatje is een van de gezelligste straatjes van het historische centrum. Wegens een graffiti kunstwerk en overhangende gevelbeplanting is het een echte foto-hotspot.

Antwerpen is een levendige stad met veel mogelijkheden. Daarom ligt er bij aankomst een magazine klaar met alle toeristische maar ook local hotspots die een bezoek waard zijn.

The Delhaize Criee supermarket (in Chinatown), which is about a three-minute walk from the building, has a large selection of good-quality meat and fish. And it is only closed on Mondays.

Antwerp
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in a lovely and quiet neighborhood near the National Bank and the main city park.

Tram 7 (stops in front of the door) takes you right through the center of Antwerp, via the Mechelseplein and the Meir, to 't Eilandje (Museum aan de Stroom).

You can easily walk to the Mechelseplein (5 min.) for drinks, and to the Theaterplein (7 min.) to browse the Exotic market (Saturday) and the Bird market (Sunday). Also den Botaniek (botanical garden), the Zoo, the Central Station, the shopping streets and 't Zuid are also within walking distance.

Zowel het onlangs gerenoveerde Koninklijk Museum van Schone Kunsten als het Museum van Hedenaagse Kunst bevinden zich op 5min wandelen. De Grote Markt, Kathedraal en Groenplaats bereik je na 10min wandelen (tip: wandel door de Kloosterstraat vol met geweldige antiekwinkels en vintage-boetiekjes!).

Around the corner, you will find delicious takeaway pizza or tajine, the choice is yours. You can walk in 15 minutes to the Zurenborg district with the hip Dawn Place and the beautiful Cogels-Osylei. You can also reach the Chinese and Jewish quarter and the bird market on foot. The department store “Carrefour express” around the corner is open until 8 pm and on Sundays until 1 pm. name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Fashion District, five minutes away from the city center, is a fashion hub dotted with Belgian designers’ boutiques and cool vintage stores, plus global eateries and lively pubs. Antique shops cluster on Kloosterstraat, where the colorful Stripmuur Nero mural decorates the side of a building. The 16th-century church of St. Andrew has Gothic vaults and baroque altars, while CoStA is a community space offering live music and children’s activities.

The Fashion Museum is the public face of the neighbourhood, and in the Nationalestraat and Kammenstraat area vintage clothing and haute couture go hand in hand. There’s always something going on in this district.

neighborhood_overview:
Het Eilandje has not stolen its name: Antwerp’s oldest port area is surrounded by water. Today, port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the port feeling still prevails here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones. Even if you are familiar with this fast-changing neighbourhood, we recommend that you return regularly because things change so quickly.

Thanks to three crowd-pullers, the MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House, the link between the city and the water is underlined once more.

Het Eilandje is the northernmost neighbourhood of Antwerp. The Port of Antwerp used to be located here, after it slowly moved out of the city centre. So here you will find several docks, some even ordered by Napoleon Bonaparte! And around the docks, you can see the many house-high warehouses, which have now been transformed into fancy lofts.

neighborhood_overview:
Het appartement is gelegen in de mooie residentiële Tentoonstellingswijk. Van hieruit ben je heel snel in het centrum van Antwerpen maar ook in de buurt zelf kan je heel wat bezoeken.

In het centrum geraak je gemakkelijk via het openbaar vervoer (tram- en bushaltes op 1 min wandelen), via een stadsfiets (station recht voor de deur) of te voet (25 minuten).

Op wandelafstand vind je een kleine supermarkt, een paar ontbijt en lunch mogelijkheden, enkele restaurants en een aantal prachtige parken die zeker het bezoeken waard zijn!

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.99 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Het appartement ligt tussen het Antwerps historisch centrum en het Eilandje. Naar de grote Markt stap je in 15 minuten, Museum het MAS ligt op 5 minuten wandelen. Een operabezoek, een balletvoorstelling, shoppen op winkelstraat Meir of stappen naar het Antwerps centraal station, je bent nooit langer dan 20 minuten onderweg. Er is een publieke parking op 300m, verschillende stadsfietsstations (Velo) op een paar minuten wandelen en een tramhalte nabij.
Ondanks de rustige ligging van het appartement ben je nooit ver weg van een supermarkt (BioPlanet, AH, Carrefour, Delhaize), bakker (Dellafaille, Diné) of slager (Rosier, Millevaches) en cafeetjes, bistrots of (sterren)restaurants. En verkies je de toeristische eetgelegenheden rond de Grote Markt en de Kathedraal, minder dan een kwartiertje stappen en je hebt keuze te over!

In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral.
